intro: Syrenia biebersteinii, commonly known as the silverleaf syrenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and often covered in a fine, silvery down. Syrenia biebersteinii is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
